result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:00 AM Defendant Tanya M Turney in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Tanya M Turney. ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Motion to modify bond heard by the Court. Court grants bond motion.  $2,500 Signature bond set: Maintain absolute sobriety Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, Curfew of 10:00 pm to 6:00 am seven days a week. Amended bond form.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
